alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Forrest and central Lamar Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 708 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Baxterville, or 14 miles southwest of West Hattiesburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pine Ridge around 725 PM CDT. Hattiesburg around 735 PM CDT. Oak Grove around 745 PM CDT. West Hattiesburg around 755 PM CDT. Rawls Springs around 800 PM CDT. Petal around 815 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
